$$
j_{\nu} = \frac{4 e^6}{3 c^3 \varepsilon_0^2 m_e} \cdot \left( \frac{2 \pi}{3 k_B T m_e} \right)^{1/2} \cdot Z^2 n_e n_i \cdot \frac{g_{ff}}{\nu} \cdot \exp\left(-\frac{h \nu}{k_B T}\right)

But perhaps the clearest approach is to use the standard SI formula:

- $\varepsilon_0 = 8.8541878128 \times 10^{-12}$ F/m
